intro: Sparganium natans f. gracilis, commonly known as the slender floating burr, is a variant of the water burr plant. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated stems that float on the water surface. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its inflorescence consists of small, yellowish flowers that develop into spiky, woody fruits. This subspecies is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds and lakes.
